Title: Business Intelligence Design of Rural Bank Performance Assessment Using Financial Ratio Analysis
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Massardi, A.E., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suharjito, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Utama, D.N., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: There are more than 1600 rural banks (BPR) registered in the OJK. But not all of them are a healthy company that has a good financial condition. One of the methods to assess bank's financial performance is by using financial ratio analysis. To analyze all BPR financial condition using financial ratio analysis will require so many time and effort. That's why Business Intelligence is needed to provide a fast and reliable information for top management in Bank Andara to help them make decisions regarding their potential customer's financial condition. This paper will result in a design of a business intelligence application that will adhere to required financial ratios needed by management user to analyze BPR's financial condition and resulting in a comprehensive and interactive dashboard that will help them to make decisions. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: bank's performance; business intelligence; financial ratio; rural bank
Index Keywords: Competitive intelligence; Decision making; Information analysis; Information management; Bank performance; bank's performance; Business intelligence applications; Financial performance; Financial ratio analysis; Financial ratios; Potential customers; Top management; Finance
